title: Govt to intensify efforts to enhance public understanding of diesel subsidy rationalisation, says Amir Hamzah
summary: The government will intensify efforts to provide better understanding to the public, especially farmers, on the rationalisation of diesel subsidies, Finance Minister II Datuk Seri Amir Hamzah Azizan said.
content:
KLANG (June 8): The government will intensify efforts to provide better understanding to the public, especially farmers, on the rationalisation of diesel subsidies, Finance Minister II Datuk Seri Amir Hamzah Azizan said. 

He said the first thing to clarify is that applications for the targeted diesel subsidy are not limited to the Budi Agri-Komoditi scheme alone.

“They need to be informed of the criteria and other schemes that

title: Fire engulfs 14 containers in West Port, Klang
summary: A total of 14 containers containing various industrial goods at West Port, Pulau Indah in Klang caught fire earlier on Saturday.
content:
SHAH ALAM (June 8): A total of 14 containers containing various industrial goods at West Port, Pulau Indah in Klang caught fire earlier on Saturday.

Selangor Fire and Rescue Department director Wan Md Razali Wan Ismail said 24 personnel, including officers, were deployed to the scene, after a call was received at 1.40pm.

“The fire involved 14 containers, each measuring 40 ft. The task of relocating the burning containers was carried out by West Po

title: Works Ministry confirms no structural cracks on Setiawangsa-Pantai Expressway flyover
summary: The Works Ministry on Saturday confirmed that there are no structural cracks in the crosshead of the Setiawangsa-Pantai Expressway (SPE) interchange on Jalan Cheras.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (June 8): The Works Ministry on Saturday confirmed that there are no structural cracks in the crosshead of the Setiawangsa-Pantai Expressway (SPE) interchange on Jalan Cheras.

In a brief statement posted on X, formerly Twitter, the ministry informed that an inspection conducted at 11.30pm on Friday revealed only construction joint lines, remnants from previous concrete work.

“The consulting firm has also verified that the highway portal st

title: Status of six MPs expelled from Bersatu to be decided by Speaker, says Zahid
summary: The status of six Members of Parliament who were expelled from Parti Pribumi Bersatu Malaysia (Bersatu) will be determined by the Speaker of the Dewan Rakyat, said Deputy Prime Minister Datuk Seri Dr Ahmad Zahid Hamidi.
content:
BANTING (June 8): The status of six Members of Parliament who were expelled from Parti Pribumi Bersatu Malaysia (Bersatu) will be determined by the Speaker of the Dewan Rakyat, said Deputy Prime Minister Datuk Seri Dr Ahmad Zahid Hamidi.

Zahid believes the status of the representatives will be decided based on the provisions contained in the anti-party hopping law.

"We leave it to the Speaker's discretion, and await the parliamentary session at th

title: Govt approves additional allocation of RM200m to boost TVET
summary: The government has approved an immediate allocation of RM200 million to strengthen and enhance youth participation in technical and vocational education and training (TVET).
content:
BANTING (June 8): The government has approved an immediate allocation of RM200 million to strengthen and enhance youth participation in technical and vocational education and training (TVET).

Prime Minister Datuk Seri Anwar Ibrahim said that the additional allocation, to be channelled through Skills Development Fund Corp, aims to encourage TVET institutions to develop and empower training programmes in line with current needs of industries.

"We want high-im

title: PM mulls larger allocations for TVET if there is no abuse
summary: The field of technical and vocational education and training (TVET) can be empowered with larger allocations if acts of corruption that cause the country to lose hundreds of millions of ringgit do not occur, said Datuk Seri Anwar Ibrahim.
content:
BANTING (June 8): The field of technical and vocational education and training (TVET) can be empowered with larger allocations if acts of corruption that cause the country to lose hundreds of millions of ringgit do not occur, said Datuk Seri Anwar Ibrahim.

The prime minister said that acts of misconduct and betrayal of trust must be fought and stopped immediately, as TVET had been identified as having great potential to grow and attract foreign investment demanding high focus and expenditure by the govern

title: Melaka CM says Chinese star Fan Bingbing's appointment as tourism ambassador to draw international tourists
summary: The appointment of Chinese film star Fan Bingbing as a tourism ambassador this year can make a significant impact on Melaka, especially in drawing international tourists, said Chief Minister Datuk Seri Ab Rauf Yusoh.
content:
MELAKA (June 8): The appointment of Chinese film star Fan Bingbing as a tourism ambassador this year can make a significant impact on Melaka, especially in drawing international tourists, said Chief Minister Datuk Seri Ab Rauf Yusoh.

He said the celebrity had a massive social media following, and can leverage the platform to promote Melaka internationally, thus boosting the state's tourism sector, especially during the Visit Melaka Year 2024.

"I have listened to

title: PN candidate for Sungai Bakap to be announced on June 16, says Tuan Ibrahim
summary: The candidate representing Perikatan Nasional (PN) in the Sungai Bakap state by-election in Penang will be announced on June 16, said PAS deputy president Datuk Seri Tuan Ibrahim Tuan Man.
content:
PAPAR (June 8): The candidate representing Perikatan Nasional (PN) in the Sungai Bakap state by-election in Penang will be announced on June 16, said PAS deputy president Datuk Seri Tuan Ibrahim Tuan Man.

He said a PAS party-level meeting was held on Friday, and received a list of names proposed as the candidate for the by-election, and the PAS leadership is looking into the names before being brought to the party's Syura Council.

"Usually, we will send two

title: Four, including public servants, nabbed over alleged monthly bribes of up to RM500,000 from illegal business premises
summary: The Malaysian Anti-Corruption Commission (MACC) has detained four men, including three public servants, for allegedly accepting monthly bribes of up to RM500,000 from illegal business premises here.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (June 8): The Malaysian Anti-Corruption Commission (MACC) has detained four men, including three public servants, for allegedly accepting monthly bribes of up to RM500,000 from illegal business premises here.

An MACC source said a deputy director of a local government authority and two of its personnel, including an enforcement officer, are being remanded for seven days until next Friday, adding that another suspect, a former enforcement officer, is placed under a five-day remand until next Wednes

title: PLUS to open Putrajaya-Elite contraflow lane to facilitate road paving
summary: PLUS Malaysia Bhd will activate a contraflow lane between Putrajaya and the Putrajaya Toll Plaza on the Elite Highway next Monday to Wednesday.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (June 8): PLUS Malaysia Bhd will activate a contraflow lane between Putrajaya and the Putrajaya Toll Plaza on the Elite Highway next Monday to Wednesday.

In a statement on Saturday, PLUS said the contraflow lane from KM P3.3 to KM P1.9 is to facilitate road paving works.

“The paving works will take place from 9pm on June 10 (Monday) until 5.30am on June 11, and will continue from 9pm on Tuesday until 5.30am on June 12,” it said.

title: Let MACC probe claims of bribe collection by DBKL officers, says Zaliha
summary: Minister in the Prime Minister's Department (Federal Territories) Dr Zaliha Mustafa is leaving it entirely to the Malaysian Anti-Corruption Commission (MACC) to investigate allegations that senior Kuala Lumpur City Hall (DBKL) officials are accepting bribes monthly.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (June 8): Minister in the Prime Minister's Department (Federal Territories) Dr Zaliha Mustafa is leaving it entirely to the Malaysian Anti-Corruption Commission (MACC) to investigate allegations that senior Kuala Lumpur City Hall (DBKL) officials are accepting bribes monthly.

She reminded all local authority staff and officers to always maintain good governance and integrity in performing their duties.

“Ultimately, we will know the re

title: Govt preparing agenda for aged nation by 2030, says Nancy
summary: The government, through the Economy Ministry, is currently preparing the Ageing National Agenda for an aged nation by 2030, which focuses on medium- and long-term socio-economic development plans, as Malaysia moves towards an aged nation by 2030, and super-aged nation by 2044.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (June 8): The government, through the Economy Ministry, is currently preparing the Ageing National Agenda for an aged nation by 2030, which focuses on medium- and long-term socio-economic development plans, as Malaysia moves towards an aged nation by 2030, and super-aged nation by 2044.

Women, Family and Community Development Minister Datuk Seri Nancy Shukri said various ministries and stakeholders support the effort, and it is aligned with the whole-of-nation approach.

title: Nanta instructs immediate inspection of cracks on Jalan Cheras flyover
summary: The Malaysian Highway Authority and the Setiawangsa-Pantai Expressway (SPE) concessionaire have been instructed to immediately inspect the cracks on the Jalan Cheras flyover.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (June 8): The Malaysian Highway Authority and the Setiawangsa-Pantai Expressway (SPE) concessionaire have been instructed to immediately inspect the cracks on the Jalan Cheras flyover.

Works Minister Datuk Sri Alexander Nanta Linggi, in a post on X, said the safety of all quarters, especially road users, must be prioritised.

He said this in response to a post on X that pointed out the increasingly visible cracks on the flyover.

title: The Policy Puzzle: What the AI pessimists are missing
summary: Pessimism suffuses current discussions about generative artificial intelligence. A YouGov survey in March found that Americans primarily feel “cautious” or “concerned” about AI, whereas only one in five are “hopeful” or “excited”. Around four in 10 are very or somewhat concerned that AI could put...
content:
This article first appeared in Forum, The Edge Malaysia Weekly on June 3, 2024 - June 9, 2024

Pessimism suffuses current discussions about generative artificial intelligence. A YouGov survey in March found that Americans primarily feel “cautious” or “concerned” about AI, whereas only one in five are “hopeful” or “excited”. Around four in 10 are very or somewhat concerned that AI could put an end to the human race.

title: The Week Ahead: Attention on US Fed monetary policy decision, CPI data
summary: All eyes will be on the US Federal Reserve at the Federal Open Market Committee meeting on June 13 (Thursday) on whether it will keep interest rates on hold at 5.25% to 5.5% or make the surprise move of cutting it earlier than expected.
content:
This article first appeared in The Edge Malaysia Weekly on June 10, 2024 - June 16, 2024

All eyes will be on the US Federal Reserve at the Federal Open Market Committee meeting on June 13 (Thursday) on whether it will keep interest rates on hold at 5.25% to 5.5% or make the surprise move of cutting it earlier than expected.

title: Azalina leads delegation to Australia for empirical study on separation of powers of AGC and public prosecutor
summary: Minister in the Prime Minister’s Department (Law and Institutional Reform) Datuk Seri Azalina Othman Said headed a Malaysian delegation to Australia to continue an empirical study on the structure and separation of powers of the attorney general and public prosecutor.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (June 8): Minister in the Prime Minister’s Department (Law and Institutional Reform) Datuk Seri Azalina Othman Said headed a Malaysian delegation to Australia to continue an empirical study on the structure and separation of powers of the attorney general and public prosecutor.

Azalina in a statement on Friday said the working visit from June 2 to 6 included her deputy M Kulasegaran, Parliamentary Special Select Committee on Human Rights, Elections and Institutional R

title: Budi Madani cash assistance sufficient for most diesel users, says Amir Hamzah
summary: Some 80% of diesel users will receive enough under the Budi Madani programme, which provides a monthly cash assistance, to make up the difference between the current diesel price and the new price to be determined later.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (June 8): Some 80% of diesel users will receive enough under the Budi Madani programme, which provides a monthly cash assistance, to make up the difference between the current diesel price and the new price to be determined later.

Finance Minister II Datuk Seri Amir Hamzah Azizan said the cash aid of RM200 per month was determined after studying data in terms of usage, as well as data from the Department of Statistics Malaysia (DOSM).

title: 'Ringgit to strengthen'
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: The ringgit should generally continue making a strong stride this year after strengthening against the US dollar and Singapore dollar in the past few weeks, economists say.The local currency may even be traded at under 4.200 versus the ...
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: The ringgit should generally continue making a strong stride this year after strengthening against the US dollar and Singapore dollar in the past few weeks, economists say.

The local currency may even be traded at under 4.200 versus the greenback this year, buoyed by significant events and favourable economic conditions, according to an economist.

Year-to-date in the second quarter of 2024, the ringgit appreciated by about 0.5 per cent against the US dollar, setting it apart from other Asian currencies which

title: Prioritising incentives for strategic industries
summary: Malaysia has always prided itself on being one of the top destinations in Southeast Asia for foreign direct investment (FDI), especially in manufacturing, predicated on its abundant land bank, readily available infrastructure and skilled workforce.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (June 8): Malaysia has always prided itself on being one of the top destinations in Southeast Asia for foreign direct investment (FDI), especially in manufacturing, predicated on its abundant land bank, readily available infrastructure and skilled workforce.

Consequently, the country has over the past few decades accumulated manufacturing businesses of various kinds in the value-add chain, including some it would not have courted in this day and age.

title: Wall St Week Ahead: All eyes on inflation, Fed meeting
summary: Investors will closely watch next week’s inflation numbers and Federal Reserve meeting for clues on whether the soft landing hopes that drove stocks to record highs are still justified.
content:
Plenty of investors believe strong corporate results and a relatively benign macroeconomic environment can keep supporting stocks.

NEW YORK: Investors will closely watch next week’s inflation numbers and Federal Reserve meeting for clues on whether the soft landing hopes that drove stocks to record highs are still justified.

title: Oil dips on Opec+ decision, deflated rate-cut hopes
summary: Oil prices edged down on Friday and posted a third straight weekly loss as investors weighed Opec+ reassurances against the latest US jobs data that lowered expectations that the Federal Reserve will cut interest rates soon.
content:
Brent crude futures settled 25 cents lower at US$79.62 a barrel, while US West Texas Intermediate crude (WTI) fell 2 cents to US$75.53.

NEW YORK: Oil prices edged down on Friday and posted a third straight weekly loss as investors weighed Opec+ reassurances against the latest US jobs data that lowered expectations that the Federal Reserve will cut interest rates soon.

title: Wall St stocks close lower on jobs data, interest rates
summary: Wall Street stocks ended slightly lower on Friday in choppy trading after stronger-than-expected US jobs data pointed to a robust economy but prompted worries the Federal Reserve may wait longer to cut interest rates than many investors had hoped.
content:
The Dow fell 87.18 points, or 0.22%, to 38,798.99, the S&P 500 lost 5.97 points, or 0.11%, to 5,346.99 and the Nasdaq lost 39.99 points, or 0.23%, to 17,133.13.

title: Bursa Malaysia grabs investor interest
summary: Will 2024 be another year of two halves for Bursa Malaysia like in 2023 and 2022? Unlikely, market analysts predict. Price action on the local exchange and global markets says it all.
content:
Yong: The recently concluded 1Q24 reporting season suggested corporate earnings have improved and would likely gain momentum in the coming quarters.

WILL 2024 be another year of two halves for Bursa Malaysia like in 2023 and 2022? Unlikely, market analysts predict. Price action on the local exchange and global markets says it all.

Kia Apac president and chief executive officer Kiseok Ahn.

Orangeleaf Consulting co-founder Tim Hendricks with CEO and co-founder Ellice Ng Pui San.

content:
What is most telling is the sharp increase in the FBM KLCI forecast with the market now looking at a year-end level of 1,704 points, against just 1,618 points three months ago.

title: Off to a strong start
summary: Property developers have kicked off the first quarter of their current financial year (1Q24) commendably, posting higher year-on-year earnings and bringing themselves a step closer towards achieving their respective sales targets.
content:
S P Setia president and chief executive officer Datuk Choong Kai Wai.

PROPERTY developers have kicked off the first quarter of their current financial year (1Q24) commendably, posting higher year-on-year earnings and bringing themselves a step closer towards achieving their respective sales targets.

The improving property market should also help to bolster sales, say analysts.

title: Nvidia powering Wall Street’s record run
summary: A rally that has propelled US equities to record highs increasingly rests on red-hot chipmaker Nvidia and a handful of other giant stocks, reviving concerns that the market’s performance has become tied to a cluster of companies.
content:
Nvidia has alone accounted for about a third of the S&P 500 index’s gain. — Reuters

A rally that has propelled US equities to record highs increasingly rests on red-hot chipmaker Nvidia and a handful of other giant stocks, reviving concerns that the market’s performance has become tied to a cluster of companies.

title: Further upside expected for FBM KLCI
summary: When the FBM KLCI touched the 1,600-point psychological barrier in early May, there was scepticism on whether the benchmark index could sustain above these levels.
content:
Wong: Utility counters’ out-performance may continue.

WHEN the FBM KLCI touched the 1,600-point psychological barrier in early May, there was scepticism on whether the benchmark index could sustain above these levels.

Thankfully, the index held up and even surged above the 2022 high of 1,620, hitting a new three-year high of 1,632.79 points on May 23, buoyed mainly by support from foreign institutional bu

title: UOB Malaysia to provide finance for SEDC Energy’s green projects
summary: UOB Malaysia has signed a memorandum of understanding (MoU) with SEDC Energy Sdn Bhd to support businesses in Sarawak as well as the state’s energy sector.
content:
UOB Malaysia chief executive officer Ng Wei Wei.

PETALING JAYA: UOB Malaysia has signed a memorandum of understanding (MoU) with SEDC Energy Sdn Bhd to support businesses in Sarawak as well as the state’s energy sector.

SEDC Energy which is a subsidiary of Sarawak Economic Development Corp stated UOB Malaysia will provide financing facilities to SEDC Energy’s supply chain consisting of suppliers, vendors

title: Go Hub inks underwriting agreement
summary: Go Hub Capital Bhd (Go Hub) has entered into an underwriting agreement with UOB Kay Hian Securities (M) Sdn Bhd in conjunction with its initial public offering (IPO) on the ACE Market of Bursa Malaysia.
content:
Tan Cherng Thong, executive director and CEO of Go Hub (left), with David Lim, CEO of UOB Kay Hian Securities.

PETALING JAYA: Go Hub Capital Bhd (Go Hub) has entered into an underwriting agreement with UOB Kay Hian Securities (M) Sdn Bhd in conjunction with its initial public offering (IPO) on the ACE Market of Bursa Malaysia.

title: Ports to benefit from recent surge in container rates globally
summary: The ports sector is poised to be a net beneficiary of the recent surge in container rates globally as volumes rise.
content:
The latest surge in container rates is reminiscent of the surge in container rates globally during the recent pandemic. — AFP

THE ports sector is poised to be a net beneficiary of the recent surge in container rates globally as volumes rise.

While ports and logistics companies will gain from this, a sustained surge in the longer term could, however, lead to overall pricier goods to the consumers.

title: The power and water factors
summary: Data centres are the latest craze in corporate Malaysia and stocks are surging as companies jump onto the multi-billion-ringgit bandwagon.
content:
Analysts point out that the main driver for electricity demand growth in Malaysia will be data centres, moving forward.

DATA centres are the latest craze in corporate Malaysia and stocks are surging as companies jump onto the multi-billion-ringgit bandwagon.

title: ByteDance plans RM10bil investment in Malaysia for AI, says minister
summary: China’s ByteDance, parent of social media app TikTok, plans to invest around RM10bil to set up an artificial intelligence (AI) hub in Malaysia, according to the country’s trade minister.
content:
As part of the deal, ByteDance will also expand its data centre facilities in Johor.

KUALA LUMPUR: China’s ByteDance, parent of social media app TikTok, plans to invest around RM10bil to set up an artificial intelligence (AI) hub in Malaysia, according to the country’s trade minister.

ByteDance Ltd is a Chinese Internet technology company headquartered in Haidian, Beijing. As part of the deal, the latest
